intro: Dalechampia sylvestris, commonly known as the wild champa, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
